snippet: The police said a person was in custody following an attack along the Hudson River.
abstract: Emotionally disturbed man wielding scissors stabs or slashes five people in Riverside Park in  Manhattan in an outburst of random violence; police arrest Julius Graham, who had been living in a homeless shelter in the Bronx; all five victims, some wounded critically, are expected to survive.

byline.original: By MARC SANTORA and J. DAVID GOODMAN
byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Julie Bosman, Alan Feuer, Emma G. Fitzsimmons, Daniel Krieger, Jesse Newman and Alex Vadukul.

lead_paragraph: The police said a person was in custody following an attack along the Hudson River.

headline.main: Five Are Injured by an Attacker With Scissors in Riverside Park
headline.print_headline: Five Are Injured by an Attacker With Scissors in Riverside Park
